messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] computer games
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/30/02 11:34:34 AM Central Standard Time, ... Moly loves to play a game called Clue Finders. Two years ago, my Mom got her the third grade
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/30/02 11:34:34 AM Central Standard Time,
ncfarms@... writes:

> My son, Bay (12), is asking for some computer games to "do some cool math &
> other stuff" - which I am happy to provide. But, when I look on websites I
> am completely overwhelmed by the sheer volume and inadequate descriptions
> of them.

Moly loves to play a game called Clue Finders. Two years ago, my Mom got her
the third grade level for Christmas. She didn't know what level to get for
Moly. At first it was kind of hard for her, but now she just breezes through
it. She wants me to find another level for her. In the game, you solve
puzzles in Math, English, Spelling... to win the game. It is definitely on
the schoolish side, but I know Moly doesn't seem to mind.

~Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
